instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00687-A died when closing bottom cover
threads.message:
Hi, 820-00687-A died when closing bottom cover after successful repair (hall sensor on keyboard).
First it had 20v 0a only on one side of usb-c. After replacing U3100 (from ssd dead board CD3215C00 same markings) got 20v 0a on both sides of the cable.

Power rails:
8.69v PPBUS_G3H 
20.06v PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H
8.7v PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
20.06v PPVBUS_LIO
20.4v PPDCIN_G3H
3.31v PP3V3_G3H
3.31v PP3V3R3V0_AON
5.06v PP5V_G3H
PP5v_S5 = 5.0v
PP3v3_S5 = 3.32v
PP3v3_SUS = 0v
PPVCORE_SUS_PCH = 0v
PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1 & PH2 0.00v
PM_SLP_S4_L = 0v

What also found (before, without and after CD3215C00 replacement):
USB_EXTA_P/N - SHORTED TO GRUND

Does this means that PCH is dead? Tested with 3 different dc cables, 2 chargers, 3 cables.
Thanks in advance.

threads.title: 820-00687-A died when closing bottom cover
threads.message:
Can be PCH, or U3100; both connected to these lines.

A1534 board are waste of time, all end with dead CPU...

threads.title: 820-00687-A died when closing bottom cover
threads.message: without U3100 the USB_EXTA_P/N was still shorted to ground. Is there any solution for data recovery?

threads.title: 820-00687-A died when closing bottom cover
threads.message:
No way for this board.
If the client didn't make backups, data is lost.
